result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua J. Annis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the owners of Borders Inn & Suites and Detective Mike Schroeder within 30 days and must be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommended by that evaluation.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance with out a valid prescription.  Defendant shall obtain HSED or GED or attend Medford Adult Diploma Academy or similar program.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence may be served with huber.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail.  and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change. Defendant shall undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Borders Inn and Suites and to Detective Mike Schroeder and must be approved by Taylor County Victim/Witness Coordinator. Defendant must successfully complete the two (2) year probationary period.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the state, the court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period to two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the state will move to dismiss the felony charge.

Deferred entry of judgment agreement

Defendant Joshua J. Annis in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Joshua J. Annis in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court questions DE. DE freely and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Information to be filed by end of the day.  No objection. DE plead no contest to Counts 1, 2 & 4.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Factual basis exists. Court dismissed and read in count 3.  Court finds DE guilty of Counts 1 & 2 and order withheld sentence: DE placed on probation for 2 years with conditions of: Court costs on each count; DNA surcharge on Count 1; 10 days county jail with Huber on Count 2; Letter of apology to the Borders Inn & Suites and Det. Mike Schroeder within 30 days and preapproved by probation; Counseling as deemed appropriate by the probation agent; Undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommended by the evaluation; maintain absolute sobriety; shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription; obtain HSED or GED or Medford Adult diploma academy or similar program.  Court entered a deferred Entry of Judgment agreement on Count 4 for 2 years with standard terms of agreement and must undergo a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment recommendations. Sentence credit of 93 days. ba

arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua J. Annis appeared in court, in custody.  Court found probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $3,000.00 cash bond; booking;; no possession or consumpetion of alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription.  Court ordered bond as requested by the district attorney.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is May 5, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
